For example, in your case Design Thinking has the most valuable approach for your IBD project; however, we are applying another framework which result more convenient.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Collapse Subdiscussion Mackenzie Cooke

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Mackenzie Cooke

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Feb 20, 2017 Feb 20 at 11:33am
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Design Thinking, Positive Deviance and, Lean Start-up thinking all require individuals to be comfortable with taking an approach to problem solving that contradicts more intuitive human behaviors. To practice Positive Deviance, individuals with better outcomes than their peers, for example in a public health instance, are identified and studied in order to develop implementable behavioral change processes. The practice of this methodology requires the ability to identify superior outcomes and the humility to potentially abandon the status quo. To practice Design Thinking, individuals are required to focus on users’ experience, specifically their emotional response, to a process or idea for product development. To practice this methodology, individuals must be able to freely generate hypothesis, create prototypes of each, and gracefully accept failure. Finally, and perhaps most similar to Design Thinking, Lean Start-up focuses on rapid ideation and the translation of ideas into falsifiable hypotheses tested through a series of MVPs. Again, individuals practicing this methodology must be unconstrained throughout hypothesis generation and prototype creation, and willing to quickly adjust their processes in response to failure. Our Technology consulting practice was closest to implementing these mindsets with their use of Agile methodology for software development and configuring, but overall these skills weren’t developed through offered training or on-the-job practice. I believe that Design Thinking will be most valuable for our IBD team as we will be required to quickly identify potential solutions to our clients’ problems. I would be interested in learning more about situations in which my classmates used these mindsets or skills in their previous jobs.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Design Thinking, Positive Deviance and, Lean Start-up thinking all require individuals to be comfortable with taking an approach to problem solving that contradicts more intuitive human behaviors. To practice Positive Deviance, individuals with better outcomes than their peers, for example in a public health instance, are identified and studied in order to develop implementable behavioral change processes. The practice of this methodology requires the ability to identify superior outcomes and the humility to potentially abandon the status quo. To practice Design Thinking, individuals are required to focus on users’ experience, specifically their emotional response, to a process or idea for product development. To practice this methodology, individuals must be able to freely generate hypothesis, create prototypes of each, and gracefully accept failure. Finally, and perhaps most similar to Design Thinking, Lean Start-up focuses on rapid ideation and the translation of ideas into falsifiable hypotheses tested through a series of MVPs. Again, individuals practicing this methodology must be unconstrained throughout hypothesis generation and prototype creation, and willing to quickly adjust their processes in response to failure.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Our Technology consulting practice was closest to implementing these mindsets with their use of Agile methodology for software development and configuring, but overall these skills weren’t developed through offered training or on-the-job practice. I believe that Design Thinking will be most valuable for our IBD team as we will be required to quickly identify potential solutions to our clients’ problems. I would be interested in learning more about situations in which my classmates used these mindsets or skills in their previous jobs.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Collapse Subdiscussion Emily Gordon

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Emily Gordon

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Feb 20, 2017 Feb 20 at 7:58pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Design thinking, positive deviance, and lean start-up seem to me to be three concepts that fit together with some overlap and some differentiation. Design thinking is the idea that empathy for the user will lead you to find solutions to the most complex problem. Once you put yourself in the shoes of your user, you will reframe the problem and think about it in a broader context. Within this context, you can come up with many different ideas for how to solve the problem. Those ideas are then tested rapidly to get feedback from your target users. Throughout the process, your users remain central to your ideating. To succeed at design thinking, one must be empathic, comfortable with ambiguity and failure, and able to move quickly. Lean start-up fits within the design thinking framework, but focuses mainly on the prototyping step. Once you've come up with ideas for solving a problem, you reframe them as "business hypotheses". You then build minimum-viable products to test these hypotheses in order to persevere, pivot, or perish the idea. This method of building requires several of the same traits as design thinking. While empathy for user may not be as central to this approach, you must be fast, creative, and comfortable with ambiguity and failure. The organizations that are able to use both design thinking and lean start-up must foster an environment where failure is accepted. I believe this is still pretty rare in workplaces. If employees don't feel confident that they can test an idea, realize it doesn't work and reject it, these methods of designing won't work. Either people will be afraid to share the more out-of-the-box ideas, or they will hold on to ideas or hypotheses for too long after they should be rejected. Finally positive deviance circles back to the design-thinking notion of empathy. It requires really understanding a community and their challenges in order to spot the deviant behavior and successfully spread it to the rest of the group. Positive deviance is not a method of product design, but it shares an emphasis on testing that both lean startup and design thinking have. By identifying positive behaviors and building off of them, you are building a program based off what works and rejecting what doesn't. While applied differently, this is the same idea as an MVP in lean startup.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Design thinking, positive deviance, and lean start-up seem to me to be three concepts that fit together with some overlap and some differentiation. Design thinking is the idea that empathy for the user will lead you to find solutions to the most complex problem. Once you put yourself in the shoes of your user, you will reframe the problem and think about it in a broader context. Within this context, you can come up with many different ideas for how to solve the problem. Those ideas are then tested rapidly to get feedback from your target users. Throughout the process, your users remain central to your ideating. To succeed at design thinking, one must be empathic, comfortable with ambiguity and failure, and able to move quickly.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Lean start-up fits within the design thinking framework, but focuses mainly on the prototyping step. Once you've come up with ideas for solving a problem, you reframe them as "business hypotheses". You then build minimum-viable products to test these hypotheses in order to persevere, pivot, or perish the idea. This method of building requires several of the same traits as design thinking. While empathy for user may not be as central to this approach, you must be fast, creative, and comfortable with ambiguity and failure. The organizations that are able to use both design thinking and lean start-up must foster an environment where failure is accepted. I believe this is still pretty rare in workplaces. If employees don't feel confident that they can test an idea, realize it doesn't work and reject it, these methods of designing won't work. Either people will be afraid to share the more out-of-the-box ideas, or they will hold on to ideas or hypotheses for too long after they should be rejected.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Finally positive deviance circles back to the design-thinking notion of empathy. It requires really understanding a community and their challenges in order to spot the deviant behavior and successfully spread it to the rest of the group. Positive deviance is not a method of product design, but it shares an emphasis on testing that both lean startup and design thinking have. By identifying positive behaviors and building off of them, you are building a program based off what works and rejecting what doesn't. While applied differently, this is the same idea as an MVP in lean startup.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Jennifer Hoss

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Jennifer Hoss

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Feb 26, 2017 Feb 26 at 6:37pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The main difference between the three methods to me appears that design thinking and lean startup are different processes to come up with innovative new ideas, while positive deviance is more about taking the learnings of others and applying them to your own organization. I am absolutely supportive of leveraging best practices, but I am struggling to understand how positive deviance is actual a method of generating innovation. It requires the innovative idea to already be generated, proven, and then to be scalable and applicable to the problem you are trying to solve.  My previous organization attempted to take a Design Thinking approach to development. I think we were extremely successful at keeping the consumer at the heart of our design decisions by focusing on their emotional needs and reactions. This was made possible by thoughtful market research aligning to the Observe and Notice stage, as well as frequent prototyping of evolving fidelity to allow for validating our design with users and purchasers. However, as a class 3 regulated medical device, our organization was paralyzed by the quality expectation and very little room for failure or mistakes. This low tolerance for risk and failure resulted in backlash over every problem, ultimately extending the schedule by 2 years and limiting the ability of the team to approach challenges more innovatively.  I am very interested in the actual product output as a balance between design thinking and lean start-up. In theory, going with the minimum viable product allows for regular product iterations and improvements with a fast and flexible development cycle. However, as I experienced within my organization, there are not always resources or commitment to continue this product iteration. From my experience, if you didn't fit something in the requirements on the first release, it would never make it into the product. This makes the initial launch slow and complex, however it ensures that you will not be left with a less than viable product. Does anyone have successful examples of how companies successfully have been able to really get at the heart of customers' complex problems while still staying flexible? What do you have to trade-off? How do you guarantee up front that eventually you will have a fully functional solution to meet long term needs and the innovating won't just end early? Very curious to hear how others have handled this!
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        The main difference between the three methods to me appears that design thinking and lean startup are different processes to come up with innovative new ideas, while positive deviance is more about taking the learnings of others and applying them to your own organization. I am absolutely supportive of leveraging best practices, but I am struggling to understand how positive deviance is actual a method of generating innovation. It requires the innovative idea to already be generated, proven, and then to be scalable and applicable to the problem you are trying to solve. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        My previous organization attempted to take a Design Thinking approach to development. I think we were extremely successful at keeping the consumer at the heart of our design decisions by focusing on their emotional needs and reactions. This was made possible by thoughtful market research aligning to the Observe and Notice stage, as well as frequent prototyping of evolving fidelity to allow for validating our design with users and purchasers. However, as a class 3 regulated medical device, our organization was paralyzed by the quality expectation and very little room for failure or mistakes. This low tolerance for risk and failure resulted in backlash over every problem, ultimately extending the schedule by 2 years and limiting the ability of the team to approach challenges more innovatively. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        I am very interested in the actual product output as a balance between design thinking and lean start-up. In theory, going with the minimum viable product allows for regular product iterations and improvements with a fast and flexible development cycle. However, as I experienced within my organization, there are not always resources or commitment to continue this product iteration. From my experience, if you didn't fit something in the requirements on the first release, it would never make it into the product. This makes the initial launch slow and complex, however it ensures that you will not be left with a less than viable product. Does anyone have successful examples of how companies successfully have been able to really get at the heart of customers' complex problems while still staying flexible? What do you have to trade-off? How do you guarantee up front that eventually you will have a fully functional solution to meet long term needs and the innovating won't just end early? Very curious to hear how others have handled this!

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Javier Gunther

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Javier Gunther

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Feb 27, 2017 Feb 27 at 5:17pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Jennifer, thanks for your comment! Regarding your comment about fitting every requirement on the first release, and how hard could it be to include something in the later iterations, I guess it would vary a lot between industries. I can imagine how a new specification of a medical device, in your case, could be something very hard to change over time, so I totally agree. As a counter example, I have been involved for example in some software development, in which the MPV and fast iterations works really well to start seen the actual deliverable early in the process, as long that every person involve in the process understand it to be a MVP and that new specifications and characteristics will be added to the product later on.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Jennifer, thanks for your comment! Regarding your comment about fitting every requirement on the first release, and how hard could it be to include something in the later iterations, I guess it would vary a lot between industries. I can imagine how a new specification of a medical device, in your case, could be something very hard to change over time, so I totally agree. As a counter example, I have been involved for example in some software development, in which the MPV and fast iterations works really well to start seen the actual deliverable early in the process, as long that every person involve in the process understand it to be a MVP and that new specifications and characteristics will be added to the product later on.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Collapse Subdiscussion Javier Gunther

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Javier Gunther

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Feb 27, 2017 Feb 27 at 5:11pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Out of the three different approaches to innovation that the readings discussed, I believe that the main similarities are that all of them rely on observation, fast responses and being close to the customer to evaluate the performance of the product or service and then try to solve a problem. All three approaches described are new to me, but getting to understand them is important to try to innovate within the different groups that I’ll be part of in the future. I believe that the 3 approaches are a great way to understand the depths of a problem and how to solve it, and I’ll know better once I know which project I’m in, but maybe design thinking will be more appropriate for our IBD project to really understand what the client needs in more qualitative terms. In terms of differences, Lean start up seems to be more data-driven approach, which can be difficult to get from customers or potential customers depending on the project. While I was reading, I was wondering how we could apply design thinking in the different industries that we have worked in. Any of you guys have applied design thinking in the financial industry? Examples you want to share?
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Out of the three different approaches to innovation that the readings discussed, I believe that the main similarities are that all of them rely on observation, fast responses and being close to the customer to evaluate the performance of the product or service and then try to solve a problem.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              All three approaches described are new to me, but getting to understand them is important to try to innovate within the different groups that I’ll be part of in the future. I believe that the 3 approaches are a great way to understand the depths of a problem and how to solve it, and I’ll know better once I know which project I’m in, but maybe design thinking will be more appropriate for our IBD project to really understand what the client needs in more qualitative terms. In terms of differences, Lean start up seems to be more data-driven approach, which can be difficult to get from customers or potential customers depending on the project.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              While I was reading, I was wondering how we could apply design thinking in the different industries that we have worked in. Any of you guys have applied design thinking in the financial industry? Examples you want to share?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                • Collapse Subdiscussion Tulio Da Silveira

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Tulio Da Silveira

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Mar 7, 2017 Mar 7 at 7:56pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hey Javier,    regarding Lean-startup, I believe there is a lot of opportunity to be applied in a more hands-on way. Let's say that you come up with 2 or 3 product concepts from the early stages of your design thinking process, in this case lean startup helps you test it as soon as possible (using a minimum viable product) and generate the data you need from customer feedback.  As for the financial industry, I know the Brazilian bank Itau has a whole team dedicated to innovation and their toolkits/processes are mostly based on Design Thinking. I know they have used it to test all their new website/mobile apps layouts and interface usability.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  Hey Javier, 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  regarding Lean-startup, I believe there is a lot of opportunity to be applied in a more hands-on way. Let's say that you come up with 2 or 3 product concepts from the early stages of your design thinking process, in this case lean startup helps you test it as soon as possible (using a minimum viable product) and generate the data you need from customer feedback. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  As for the financial industry, I know the Brazilian bank Itau has a whole team dedicated to innovation and their toolkits/processes are mostly based on Design Thinking. I know they have used it to test all their new website/mobile apps layouts and interface usability.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    • Collapse Subdiscussion Diego Butrich

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Diego Butrich

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Apr 16, 2017 Apr 16 at 6:48pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Javier, as I also commented on GF's post. I know one of the largest banks in Peru is using design thinking to solve problems, both for customers and internally in the organization. A couple of years ago, they started a pilot to change how their agencies worked, and how they served the customer. I think it has been an amazing transformation for them, and really talks about the commitment they have for innovation and for understanding their customers. You can find out more details in this link: https://www.trabajaeninterbank.pe/innovacion-en-interbank
