                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Hi Javier, as I also commented on GF's post. I know one of the largest banks in Peru is using design thinking to solve problems, both for customers and internally in the organization. A couple of years ago, they started a pilot to change how their agencies worked, and how they served the customer. I think it has been an amazing transformation for them, and really talks about the commitment they have for innovation and for understanding their customers.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      You can find out more details in this link: https://www.trabajaeninterbank.pe/innovacion-en-interbankLinks to an external site. 

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      • Collapse Subdiscussion Tyler Saltiel

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Tyler Saltiel

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Feb 27, 2017 Feb 27 at 6:46pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Positive deviance seems to differ from design thinking and lean start-up in a couple of ways. First, is that while design thinking and lean start-up seem to be ways to build a solution from nothing, positive deviance requires that there already be work ongoing or that the service/product be offered elsewhere with an opportunity for improvement. For positive deviance to be applicable there must be deviation from something. However, design thinking and lean start-up are both able to create a new solution where there was nothing before. Because of this, design thinking and lean start-up are both costlier and more lengthy processes. Creating from scratch takes times while positive deviance can improve upon something in a quicker and more cost-effective manner.   Lean start-up goes further than design thinking in that it evaluates an entire business model rather than a solution to a specific problem. This incorporates pivots and minimum viable products to ensure that the model will last when testing of hypothesis fail. The process also seems very long even compared to design thinking. However, all consumer feedback seems to come from hypothesis testing rather than any input at the creation of the hypothesis. While design thinking uses interviews and interactions with consumers in the observe and notice phase, lean start-up seems to imply begin with an entrepreneur’s hypothesis. My question would be what benefits there would be to starting with a hypothesis without going through the observe and notice practice? Couldn’t you improve by combing these two approaches?   Organizations I’ve worked for did not commit enough to divergence of ideas before converging again. Too often this has blended into the same step but as the reading noted, this should not be done at the same time. The exercise in our launch helped me to appreciate the value of doing these activities separately. Allowing for more time to diverge and allowing the freedom to brainstorm crazy ideas would be beneficial to reaching better solutions.   I think there is value in each of these approaches and I think each can be the most advantageous in the appropriate setting. In IBD, I expect we’ll be working with organizations that are established and don’t need as much of an evaluation of an entire business model unless they are looking to add a new division or operation. As such, I expect we will call on design thinking and positive deviance approaches most often.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Go To Topic
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Positive deviance seems to differ from design thinking and lean start-up in a couple of ways. First, is that while design thinking and lean start-up seem to be ways to build a solution from nothing, positive deviance requires that there already be work ongoing or that the service/product be offered elsewhere with an opportunity for improvement. For positive deviance to be applicable there must be deviation from something. However, design thinking and lean start-up are both able to create a new solution where there was nothing before. Because of this, design thinking and lean start-up are both costlier and more lengthy processes. Creating from scratch takes times while positive deviance can improve upon something in a quicker and more cost-effective manner.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Lean start-up goes further than design thinking in that it evaluates an entire business model rather than a solution to a specific problem. This incorporates pivots and minimum viable products to ensure that the model will last when testing of hypothesis fail. The process also seems very long even compared to design thinking. However, all consumer feedback seems to come from hypothesis testing rather than any input at the creation of the hypothesis. While design thinking uses interviews and interactions with consumers in the observe and notice phase, lean start-up seems to imply begin with an entrepreneur’s hypothesis. My question would be what benefits there would be to starting with a hypothesis without going through the observe and notice practice? Couldn’t you improve by combing these two approaches?

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Organizations I’ve worked for did not commit enough to divergence of ideas before converging again. Too often this has blended into the same step but as the reading noted, this should not be done at the same time. The exercise in our launch helped me to appreciate the value of doing these activities separately. Allowing for more time to diverge and allowing the freedom to brainstorm crazy ideas would be beneficial to reaching better solutions.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        I think there is value in each of these approaches and I think each can be the most advantageous in the appropriate setting. In IBD, I expect we’ll be working with organizations that are established and don’t need as much of an evaluation of an entire business model unless they are looking to add a new division or operation. As such, I expect we will call on design thinking and positive deviance approaches most often.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        Reply Reply to Comment
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        HTML Editor Rich Content Editor
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          Cancel
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          • Collapse Subdiscussion Hans Klinger

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hans Klinger

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Mar 2, 2017 Mar 2 at 3:17pm
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Tyler, I agree with you that positive deviance is less like the other two as it revolves around identifying a solution that already exists, instead of creating it from scratch. I also agree that lean start-up is more iterative than designing thinking. You mentioned that one difference you see is that lean start-up requires pivoting and minimal viable products. However, design thinking also involves creating prototypes for which you can test components of the idea and collect consumer feedback. Therefore, I see the latter two as very similar. I do agree with your comment that designing thinking seems to be more singular problem focused, perhaps without a business model behind it, while lean startup has an additional component of profitability. This is an important distinction, as one is establishing viable companies - which means sustainable businesses, while the other is solving the problem regardless of sustainability. It seems lean start-up is a social enterprise with a business model, where as design thinking might lead to charities. I also agree that we'll likely not be doing lean start-up for IBD.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Manage Discussion Entry
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Go To Parent
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Edit
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Delete
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            • Open in SpeedGrader

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            Hi Tyler,

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            I agree with you that positive deviance is less like the other two as it revolves around identifying a solution that already exists, instead of creating it from scratch. I also agree that lean start-up is more iterative than designing thinking. You mentioned that one difference you see is that lean start-up requires pivoting and minimal viable products. However, design thinking also involves creating prototypes for which you can test components of the idea and collect consumer feedback. Therefore, I see the latter two as very similar. I do agree with your comment that designing thinking seems to be more singular problem focused, perhaps without a business model behind it, while lean startup has an additional component of profitability. This is an important distinction, as one is establishing viable companies - which means sustainable businesses, while the other is solving the problem regardless of sustainability. It seems lean start-up is a social enterprise with a business model, where as design thinking might lead to charities. I also agree that we'll likely not be doing lean start-up for IBD.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                79982ef8-dcc9-451c-97b2-52a1eb6c28ae
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                In order to create video or audio recordings your computer needs to be webcam-enabled. If you don't have a webcam on your computer, you can still record audio-only messages by first installing the Google Video Chat plugin.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Install the Video Plugin
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                Don't have a webcam?
